title: Ernesto projected to miss Halifax , brush past Newfoundland
message:
In what is appearing to look like a near-miss, Hurricane Ernesto’s track is bending to curve southeast of Halifax late tomorrow and brush past the south-facing coasts of Newfoundland and Labrador late Sunday.
“We expect that the track of Ernesto’s center will be well south of Nova Scotia as it travels northeastward then will approach southeastern Newfoundland later Monday,” the Canadian Hurricane Centre reports.
The forecast of Ernesto’s impact on Atlantic Canada now seems to focus more on Newfoundland and Labrador.
In Halifax, only slightly more than 5 mm of rain is forecast for early Monday, according to AccuWeather, with 32 km/h winds.
Feature image courtesy of the Canadian Hurricane Centre

title: Atlantic Ocean Category 5 Hurricane Beryl is now transitioning to the Caribbean Sea
message:
Atlantic Ocean’s Category 5 Hurricane Beryl is now transitioning to the Caribbean SeaArticle first published: Monday, July 01, 2024, 5 a.m.
Category 5 Hurricane Beryl's journey: it developed in the Atlantic Ocean, made its way to the Caribbean Sea.
Category 5 Hurricane Beryl is 445 miles east-southeast of Isla Beata Dominican Republic and 775 miles east-southeast of Kingston Jamaica, with maximum sustained wind of 165 mph.
A Tropical Storm Warning means that tropical storm conditions are expected somewhere within the warning area within 36 hours.
RAINFALL: Hurricane Beryl is expected to produce rainfall totals of 4 to 8 inches, with localized maxima of 12 inches, in portions of Jamaica on Wednesday.

title: Hurricane Ernesto bears down on Bermuda , already knocking out power
message:
Hurricane Ernesto bears down on Bermuda, already knocking out power3 minutesBy Jasmine Patterson and Nicola MuirheadBERMUDA (Reuters) -Hurricane Ernesto bore down on Bermuda on Friday as a Category 2 storm, threatening the British island territory with strong winds, a dangerous storm surge and potentially deadly flooding.
This storm is the real deal,” said Michael Weeks, Bermuda’s national security minister, at a press conference on Friday.
The winds had knocked out power for 5,400 of Bermuda’s 36,000 customers, the power utility BELCO said.
The island has experienced prolonged power outages in recent years when weather systems much more powerful than Ernesto rolled through.
Ernesto is the fifth named Atlantic storm of what is expected to be an intense hurricane season.

title: In the Caribbean : Bermuda braces for Hurricane Ernesto
message:
Bermuda is on high alert as residents brace for Hurricane Ernesto to make landfall on Friday.
In parts of Bermuda, Storm Ernesto will drop up to 380 mm of rain.
The National Hurricane Center warned of a strong storm surge and the risk of flash flooding.
The Bermuda government warned on X that the hurricane would hit the islands at 11 a.m. Saturday and asked residents to take precautions.
Earlier this week, Storm Ernesto passed close to Puerto Rico, leaving more than 600,000 people without power and flooding roads.

title: Hurricane Ernesto strengthens to Category 2 with 100 mph winds as it threatens Bermuda
message:

Please try again later {{ /verifyErrors }}Hurricane Ernesto has strengthened into a Category 2 storm with 100 mph winds as it heads for Bermuda.
In addition to hurricane-force winds, Ernesto will bring up to nine inches of rain and flash flooding to the islands.
Bermuda is set to endure “at least 36 hours of hurricane and tropical storm force winds,” Michael Weeks, Bermuda’s minister of national security, said on Friday.

title: Hurricane Ernesto slams Bermuda as British territory prepares for storm
message:
The Category 2 storm located 95 miles south-southwest of Bermuda was packing maximum sustained winds of 100 mph.
Ernesto’s large eye will likely be near or over Bermuda early Saturday morning, with significant coastal flooding expected, according to the National Hurricane Center.
In preparation for the storm, officials in the wealthy British territory suspended public transportation and closed the airport on Friday night.
Ernesto is the fifth named storm and the third hurricane of this year’s Atlantic hurricane season.
The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration has predicted an above-average Atlantic hurricane season this year because of record warm ocean temperatures.

title: Hurricane Ernesto : Nova Scotia and eastern Newfoundland told to watch for big waves – Winnipeg Free Press
message:
HALIFAX – Residents of Nova Scotia and eastern Newfoundland are being told to keep a close watch on the progress of Hurricane Ernesto as it churns its way northward, pushing big waves far from its swirling centre.
As of Friday, the storm was expected to stay far to the south and east of Nova Scotia, but the Canadian Hurricane Centre in Dartmouth, N.S., said Ernesto could cause some coastal flooding in parts of eastern Newfoundland by Monday night.
This GOES-16 GeoColor satellite image taken at 4 p.m. EDT and provided by National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) shows Hurricane Ernesto northwest of San Juan, Puerto Rico and moving over open waters, Wednesday, Aug. 14, 2024.
On July 11, the remnants of hurricane Beryl flooded parts of western and central Nova Scotia with more than 100 millimetres of rain in just a few hours.
For a Category 2 hurricane, Ernesto is a large storm, with winds exceeding 120 km/h extending up to 110 kilometres from its centre.

title: Nothing compared to what Ive seen : Conway streets see flooding in Debby wake
message:
CONWAY, S.C. (WBTW) — Several streets in Conway have been closed due to the flooding from Tropical Storm Debby last week, making it difficult for residents to continue their daily plans and activities.
Riverfront Park in Conway is one location that has been affected.
The bottom of Elm and Laurel Street are both blocked off due to the excess water coming from the Waccamaw River.
A Conway resident said that this particular location is prone to flooding.
She graduated from Penn State University in May 2024 and joined the News13 team in July 2024.

message:

Learn more about Storm Stories and other education/science/factual topics on our factual page

title: Has recent rain helped S . C . farmers struggling from drought ?
message:
SAINT MATTHEWS, S.C. (WIS) — With drought conditions around the Palmetto State drastically improving following Debby last week, one farmer said the recent rain has been a mixed bag for his crops.
This week, the South Carolina Department of Natural Resources’ Drought Response Committee downgraded drought designations to normal for 36 counties.
The dry corn crop has been impacted by the double whammy brought forth by the drought and heavy rain from Debby, as well.
It was already nearly a total loss, but the rain has made it worse, Lyons said.
“Every time it rains it just adds more to that total,” Lyons said.

title: Tropical Storm Ernesto Forms In Atlantic : Here 5 - Day Projected Path
message:
The projected timing and track of the tropical rainstorm through Friday evening, Aug. 16, is shown in the image above, just released late Monday by the National Hurricane Center.
The rainstorm is "forecast to intensify and bring heavy rainfall, gusty winds, and storm surge to parts of the Lesser Antilles, Puerto Rico, and the Dominican Republic this week," according to a statement by AccuWeather.com.
Formation chance through 48 hours is high at 70 percent and through seven days even higher at 90 percent, the National Hurricane Center said.
"After moving through the islands, the storm is forecast to be pulled to the north by a southward dip in the jet stream," AccuWeather Lead Hurricane Expert Alex DaSilva said.
"The storm may continue to intensify and could become the second major hurricane of the season by the end of this week."

title: Students tackle flooding with storm drain markers
message:
I'll show how local efforts, like the storm drain marker program, are keeping our streets safe and water clean.
Over the past year and a half, students in Thomas County have installed over 350 storm drain markers to help prevent flooding and protect local waterways.
Julie Murphee, founder of Keep Thomas County Beautiful, tells me storm water is one of the main concerns for Thomas County.
"storm water is a leading cause of water pollution.
Jay Knight, construction supervisor at Thomas County, tells me they've been building retention ponds to manage stormwater.

title: Japan Evacuated Ahead of Typhoon Ampil Nearing Tokyo
message:
Environmental Protection Agency The typhoon is approaching Tokyo, where it will arrive this evening.
News News• Today at 3:28 PMThousands of Japanese are bracing for the approach of Typhoon Ampil.
Ampil is expected to make landfall in the capital Tokyo tonight.
The Japan Meteorological Agency said the typhoon had winds of up to 165 kilometers per hour.
earthquakeLast week, Japan also warned of a natural disaster, a “super-terror” with an expected magnitude of 7.1.

title: More than a dozen states grappled with  flash drought  this summer here what that means for farmers
message:
More than a dozen states grappled with 'flash drought' this summer — here's what that means for farmersAt least 15 states in the eastern U.S. were affected by various degrees of drought entering the first week of August.
In some cases, the drought came on quickly; some areas experienced a "flash drought."
A recent study found that the intensity of flash droughts is increasing worldwide.
Another study said flash droughts will double because of the changing climate of our warming world.
More than 86 million acres of major crops were also experiencing drought conditions.

title: Over 100 people apply for storm relief in Steuben County
message:
CANISTEO, N.Y. (WETM) — More than a hundred Steuben County residents are seeking recovery help from the damages inflicted by Tropical Storm Debby.
People were able to file for relief during a three-day flood relief resource event held this week at three locations in Canisteo, Greenwood, and Woodhull.
Jacqueline Saunders a flood victim of Pulteney, stated that she has damaged equipment, lost personal items, and has mud in her house.
Tropical Storm Debby is the second storm in three years that is impacting local communities since Tropical Storm Fred in 2021.
Steuben County Director of Public Safety Timothy Marshall thinks that the infrastructure damage from Debby is worse than Fred.

title: Ernesto will track south of the Maritimes on Monday
message:
Hurricane Ernesto will track well south of the Maritimes as it moves through the region on Sunday night and Monday.
A track this far south means that the heaviest rainfall and strongest winds will also remain offshore.
That said, Ernesto will be rather large and some of the outer bands of rain may edge into the Maritimes on Monday.
(Ryan Snoddon/CBC)With the track offshore, the risk of any wind impacts is low for the Maritimes.
WATCH | Ryan Snoddon's Ernesto forecast: Ernesto set to bring dangerous rip currents to N.S.

title: Hurricane Ernesto lashes Bermuda as wealthy British territory closes down
message:
SAN JUAN, Puerto Rico (AP) — Hurricane Ernesto began to pound Bermuda late Friday with heavy winds and rain after officials in the tiny British territory in the middle of the Atlantic Ocean opened shelters and closed government offices.
The Category 2 storm located 95 miles (150 kilometers) south-southwest of Bermuda... read full story"Preparations to protect life and property should be rushed to completion,"

title: Cape Breton facilities still waiting for generators
message:
Cape Breton facilities still waiting for generatorsNewsDuration 2:05Hurricane season is well underway and Cape Breton's Centre 200 and the Glace Bay Fire Hall are still waiting for generators to be installed, seven months after funding was announced.
As Kyle Moore reports, some in the area are concerned the region isn't ready for the next big storm.

title: Quebec widens scope of tropical storm Debby flooding compensation
message:
Quebec Premier François Legault said Friday afternoon that the province would now be compensating homes that were damaged by overflowing sewers as heavy rainfall caused by tropical storm Debby flooded hundreds of Quebec households.
Public Security Minister François Bonnardel joined Legault at the press briefing, updating the flooding cleanup situation as well as providing an update on flooding caused by a major water main break in south-central Montreal.
The water main break caused a geyser that lasted for hours Friday morning and was, at times, nearly as high as the nearby Jacques-Cartier Bridge.
WATCH | Water main break causes geyser near Jacques-Cartier Bridge: Water spews into Montreal streets after water main break Duration 0:33 Video captured Friday shows water bursting out of a ruptured main in downtown Montreal, near the Jacques-Cartier Bridge.
There were about 100 different places that were affected and I made the decision it would be more efficient to respond to the developing situation," Legault said.

title: Houston Rothko Chapel indefinitely closed after Hurricane Beryl damages walls and Mark Rothko art panels
message:
Houston's Rothko Chapel indefinitely closed by Hurricane Beryl damageHOUSTON, Texas -- One of the city's most-loved landmarks announced its indefinite closure, following damage from Hurricane Beryl.
The Rothko Chapel's ceiling and several walls sustained water damage following the storm, and three of Mark Rothko's panels were also affected to varying degrees.
The chapel announced this week it would remain closed while it determined its next course of action, including a full damage assessment and cost of repairs.
It enlisted Whitten & Proctor Fine Art Conservation, one of the country's premier art conservation firms, to lead the conservation analysis.
"We are deeply saddened by the impact of the hurricane on the Chapel and across Houston," executive director David Leslie said in a statement.

title: Photos & Video : Bermuda Prepares For Hurricane
message:
As Hurricane Ernesto approaches Bermuda, residents are taking precautions and securing their property in advance of the storm, which is expected to bring over 30 hours of high winds to the island.
Click here for all of our coverage of Hurricane Ernesto, and click here for our ongoing live updates on the storm.

title: Highway 53 E in Pender County reopens after flooding
message:
Highway 53 E in Pender County reopens after floodingPENDER COUNTY, NC (WWAY) — After several days of being closed due to flooding from Tropical Storm Debby, Highway 53 East in Pender County reopened on Friday.
The roadway provides a vital link between Burgaw and eastern Pender County.
With the Northeast Cape Fear River cresting for the last several days, flooding persisted long after Debby made its way north.
Pender County Maintenance Engineer Jeff Garrett says even after water recedes, roads still have to be checked for safety.
Because even using the backroads, there’s flooding,” another resident said.

title: Harris County commissioners propose tax - hike for flood control maintenance
message:
The proposed $2.6 billion budget approved by Harris County commissioners includes a tax hike for flood control.
Years after taxpayers approved spending billion on flood mitigation effort, in response the Hurricane Harvey flooding, the county flood control district says it needs more money to keep those improvements in good working order.
SUGGESTED: FOX 26 Houston is now on the FOX LOCAL app available through Apple TV, Amazon FireTV, Roku, Google Android TV, Samsung TV, and Vizio!
Harris County Precinct 2 Commissioner Adrian Garcia likens it to owning a brand-new car.
The proposed rate-hike would add about $60 to the average property-owners tax bill, and raise about $115 million to be spent on maintenance and new flood control measures.

title: Stormy Saturday Skies
message:
For the first time in weeks, rain is back in the forecast - but this round of active weather could pack an extra punch.
Showers could start towards Noontime along the Coast, but isolated Thunderstorms are expected later into the afternoon/evening hours.
Significant rainfall in areas with recent wildfire activity is a recipe for Landslides that can be damaging to life and property.
While this will likely be the busiest active weather in months, the stronger storms will likely remain on more of an Isolated to Scattered basis.
This means that some locations - especially further to the west - will likely see little more than showers.

title: Homes along the Suwannee River experiencing flooding 11 days post Hurricane Debby
message:
OLD TOWN, Fla. (WCJB) - The Crutchfields have been living along the Suwannee River for years and know what’s to come if there’s a storm.
They park their cars where the water meets the road and take a boat to their home.
“We knew what the Suwannee would do and as we have been here we’ve learned okay what to do.
Tie the picnic table down or it will float away.”Crutchfield says they’ve seen flooding much worse than it is now.
11 days post hurricane Debby they’re still taking the boat to their home that’s on fourteen feet stilts.

title: Friday Afternoon Ernesto Update : Tropical Storm Force Winds Already Observed in Bermuda : The Alabama Weather Blog
message:
Ernesto showing its strength now in Bermuda.
Max sustained winds at the center of 100 mph.
The hurricane wind extend 75 miles from the center and the tropical storm force winds reach up to 275 miles from the center.
The Bermuda International Airport has reported already, sustained winds of 41 mph and a gust to 63 mph.
#Hurricane #ERNESTO in #Bermuda pic.twitter.com/4hQgOzAPAu — Josh Morgerman (@iCyclone) August 16, 2024High surf and rip current risk remains the big hazard of the east coast of the US.
